name: Alopecia Areata
descriptor: Autoimmune disease affecting the hair follicles resulting in hair loss

name: ANCA-Associated Vasculitis
descriptor: Inflammation of small blood vessels (vasculitis) associated with antineutrophil cytoplasmic autoantibody (ANCA)

name: Allergy
descriptor: Involving the immune system reacting to environmental substances (allergens) that are harmless to most people

name: Ankylosing Spondylitis
descriptor: Common inflammatory rheumatic disease (spondyloarthritis) characterized by back pain and progressive spinal stiffness (sacroileitis and spinal inflammation)

name: Asthma
descriptor: Chronic inflammatory disorder of airways characterised by intermittent cough
column5: and shortness of breath brought on by characteristic triggers and relieved by bronchodilating medications

name: Autoimmune Thyroid Disease
descriptor: Autoimmune disease affecting the thyroid gland which may result in over or under activity (hyper- or hypo-thyroidism)

name: Behcet's Disease
descriptor: Chronic relapsing inflammatory disease involving the blood vessels and affecting the mouth

name: Celiac Disease
descriptor: Disease of small intestine with intolerance of gluten

name: Crohn's Disease
descriptor: Chronic immune-related inflammatory disorder of digestive tract
column4: most commonly involving ileum and colon

name: Graves' Disease
descriptor: Autoimmune disorder resulting in overactive thyroid gland (hyperthyroidism)

name: Gout
descriptor: Common inflammatory arthritis which may manifest as chronic arthropathy with accumulation of urate crystals as tophaceous deposits (monosodium urate crystal deposition disease)

name: IgE and Allergic Sensitization
descriptor: Immediate immune reactions mediated by IgE Ab which may affect respiratory (allergic rhinitis
column5: bowel (food allergy) and skin (extrinsic eczema) with allergic sensitisation the interplay between allergen and host in a specific environmental context

name: Idiopathic Inflammatory Myopathies
descriptor: Disorders of unknown cause characterised by inflammation of muscles (including polymyositis

name: Juvenile Idiopathic Arthritis
descriptor: Chronic childhood arthritis of unknown cause lasting more than 6 weeks

name: Kawasaki Disease
descriptor: Widespread inflammation of blood vessels (medium-sized muscular arteries) with systemic inflammation and signs of mucocutaneous inflammation

name: Myasthenia Gravis
descriptor: Autoimmune neuromuscular disorder resulting in fluctuating and variable weakness (in ocular
column6: and respiratory muscles) involving autoantibodies against acetylcholine receptors or receptor-associated proteins

name: Multiple Sclerosis
descriptor: Common immune-mediated inflammatory demyelinating disease involving the central nervous system

name: Narcolepsy
descriptor: Common neurological disorder affecting sleep-wake cycles (including daytime sleepiness with cataplexy

name: Osteoarthritis
descriptor: A progressive
column5: the most common form of arthritis (especially in older persons) causing joint pain and stiffness

name: Primary Biliary Cholangitis
descriptor: Primary biliary cholangitis (previously referred to as primary biliary cirrhosis) involving immune-mediated destruction of small intralobular bile ducts and cholestasis
column4: with risk of cirrhosis and liver failure

name: Primary Sclerosing Cholangitis
descriptor: Rare biliary disease with bile duct strictures and dilatations leading to cholestasis
column4: and risk of liver failure and cholangiocarcinoma

name: Psoriasis
descriptor: Common chronic immune-mediated skin disease
column4: most commonly characterized by well-demarcated erythematous plaques with silver scale

name: Rheumatoid Arthritis
descriptor: Symmetrical

name: Sarcoidosis
descriptor: Multisystem inflammatory granulomatous disorder of unknown cause that may affect any organ (typically lungs
column5: or lymph nodes) and characterized by noncaseating granulomas

name: Sjogren's Syndrome
descriptor: Chronic autoimmune inflammatory disorder characterized by dry eyes and mouth (reduced lacrimal and salivary gland function)

name: Systemic Lupus Erythematosus
descriptor: Chronic heterogeneous autoimmune inflammatory disease of unknown cause that can affect virtually every organ

name: Systemic Scleroderma
descriptor: Multisystem disease characterized by widespread vascular dysfunction and progressive fibrosis of the skin and internal organs

name: Type I Diabetes
descriptor: Autoimmune destruction of the insulin-producing beta cells in the islets of Langerhans rersulting in a lack of insulin

name: Ulcerative Colitis
descriptor: Recurrent inflammation of the large bowel
column4: limited to the mucosal layer of the colon and most commonly involving the rectum (may extend in a proximal and continuous fashion to involve other parts of the colon)

name: Vitiligo
descriptor: Patchy loss of skin colouring due to disorder of pigmentation (characterized by well-defined white macules on the skin due to loss of epidermal melanocytes)
